DataElement.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus Viral Load Assay Lower Threshold Detected Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the number representing the lower limit of detection of a human immunodeficiency virus viral load assay.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus Viral Load Assay Lower Threshold Detected
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the lower limit of detection (a limit below which it is not possible to measure the amount of HIV present) of a human immunodeficiency virus viral load (the number of HIV viral particles in a sample of blood plasma) assay.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus Viral Load Assay
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Human immunodeficiency virus. Species of LENTIVIRUS, subgenus primate lentiviruses (LENTIVIRUSES, PRIMATE), formerly designated T-cell lymphotropic virus type III/lymphadenopathy-associated virus (HTLV-III/LAV). It is acknowledged to be the agent responsible for the acute infectious manifestations, neurologic disorders, and immunologic abnormalities linked to the ACQUIRED IMMUNODEFICIENCY SYNDROME.:The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma.:A method of measuring the effects of a biologically active substance using an intermediate in vivo or in vitro tissue or cell model under controlled conditions. (from MSH98)

Concepts.definition: The virus isolated and recognized as the etiologic agent of AIDS. HIV-1 is classified as a lentivirus, a subtype of retroviruses.
The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma.
A laboratory test or analysis of the biological activity of a substance performed by studying its effect on an organism or in a test tube under controlled conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Lower; the bottom one of two.:The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant.:Detected; perceived or discerned.

Concepts.definition: The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Viral Load Assay Lower Threshold Detected Number
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the number representing the lower limit of detection of a viral load assay.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: AMC CRF:AIDS Malignancy Consortium Case Report Form

DataElement.origin: AMC CRF:AIDS Malignancy Consortium Case Report Form
